thread.title: Cubs knock out Cardinals, advance to NLCS with Wrigley party
thread.title_full: Cubs knock out Cardinals, advance to NLCS with Wrigley party

title: Cubs knock out Cardinals, advance to NLCS with Wrigley party
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Cubs knock out Cardinals, advance to NLCS with Wrigley party CHICAGO - They danced in the aisles Tuesday at Wrigley Field, screamed until their lungs ached, clapped until their hands were raw, and shook the joint with unadulterated joy. Post to Facebook Cubs knock out Cardinals, advance to NLCS with Wrigley party CHICAGO - They danced in the aisles Tuesday at Wrigley Field, screamed until their lungs ached, clapped until their hands were raw, and shook the joint with unadulterated joy.  //on.11alive.com/1RGc8zH   Join the Conversation To   Cubs knock out Cardinals, advance to NLCS with Wrigley party Bob Nightengale, USA TODAY Sports 8:31 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 Cubs celebrate after the 6-4 victory. (Photo: Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CHICAGO - They danced in the aisles Tuesday at Wrigley Field, screamed until their lungs ached, clapped until their hands were raw, and shook the joint with unadulterated joy. 
The Chicago Cubs, those loveable losers of the past, are now the powerful winners of the present, knocking off their rival St. Louis Cardinals, 6-4, and moving onto the National League Championship Series. 
It was the first time in the 139-year history of the franchise that the Cubs clinched a playoff series at home, turning Wrigleyville into the worldâ€™s biggest outdoor party. 
The Cubs, who will play the winner of the New York Mets-Los Angeles Dodgers NL Division Series, now are four victories away from winning their first pennant in 70 years, keeping the dream alive of winning their first World Series since 1918. Game 4 in Chicago: Fans celebrate after the Cubs win the series at Wrigley Field. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Cubs celebrate after the 6-4 victory. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Cubs closer Hector Rondon celebrates after striking out Stephen Piscotty for the final. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Kyle Schwarber crushes his third homer of the series -- this one over the RF video board. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Cubs relief pitcher Fernando Rodney does his signature bow-and-arrow gesture before he was pulled in the seventh inning. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Anthony Rizzo hits a solo home run in the sixth inning to give the Cubs a 5-4 lead in the elimination game. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Cardinals' Tony Cruz is tagged out by Cubs catcher Miguel Montero in the sixth inning. Dennis Wierzbicki, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Catcher Tony Cruz hits an RBI double in the sixth inning to cut the lead to 4-3. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Justin Grimm reacts after striking out Tony Cruz to end the fourth inning. Jonathan Daniel, Getty Images Game 4 in Chicago: Javier Baez hits a three-run homer in the second to give the Cubs a 4-2 lead. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Cardinals starter John Lackey is not happy with himself after giving up an RBI single to Cubs pitcher Jason Hammel. Nam Y. Huh, AP Game 4 in Chicago: A Cubs fan attempts to catch a home run ball hit by Stephen Piscotty and spills his drink. Jonathan Daniel, Getty Images Game 4 in Chicago: Stephen Piscotty hits a two-run home run in the first inning to give the Cardinals a 2-0 lead. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 4 in Chicago: Former Cubs pitcher Kerry Wood throws out the ceremonial first pitch before Game 4. Paul Beaty, AP Game 4 at Chicago: Fans flock to Wrigley Field for the game against the Cardinals. Jon Durr, Getty Images Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs closer Hector Rondon, right, celebrates with catcher Miguel Montero after closing out their 8-6 win for a 2-1 series lead. Dennis Wierzbicki, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs reliever Pedro Strop is fired up after ending the eighth inning with a strikeout. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Jorge Soler, right, celebrates his sixth-inning home run with Chris Coghlan. Dennis Wierzbicki, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs runner Chris Coghlan (8) dives safely back into first base on a sixth-inning pick-off attempt. Dennis Wierzbicki, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Kris Bryant, left, celebrates his fifth-inning hom run with Jorge Soler. Dennis Wierzbicki, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Dexter Fowler lays down a sacrifice bunt during the sixth inning. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Jorge Soler (68) celebrates his two-run homer with Chris Coghlan (8) during the sixth inning. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Jorge Soler watches his two-run homer leave the yard during the sixth inning. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cardinals first baseman Stephen Piscotty (55) hangs on to catch a fifth-inning pop-up after colliding with second baseman Kolten Wong (16). Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Kris Bryant watches his two-run homer leave the yard during the fifth inning. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Addison Russell slides safely into third base for a fourth-inning triple. Dennis Wierzbicki, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cardinals hitter Jason Heyward (22) celebrates his sixth-inning home run with Matt Holliday (7). Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs Kyle Schwarber watches his second-inning home run leave the yard. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs ace Jake Arrieta delivers during the first inning. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Kyle Schwarber watches his solo homer leave the yard during the second inning. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cardinals hitter Jhonny Peralta connects on an RBI double during the fourth inning. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 3 in Chicago: Cubs hitter Starlin Castro celebrates his fourth-inning home run. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cubs fans hold up W flags after a 6-3 win. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cubs closer Hector Rondon and catcher Miguel Montero celebrate evening the series. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cardinals second baseman Kolten Wong dives for the ball hit by Dexter Fowler. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cardinals third baseman Matt Carpenter attempts to double up Dexter Fowler in the 7th inning. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cardinals manager brings in Adam Wainwright as a reliever in the 7th inning. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cardinals pinch hitter Randal Grichuk hits the second home run of the inning to cut the Cubs lead to 6-3 in the fifth inning. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Kolten Wong rounds the bases after hitting a solo home run during the fifth inning. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cardinals starter Jaime Garcia allows five runs in the second inning before leaving the game with a stomach virus. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Jorge Soler is congratulated for hitting a two-run home run in the second inning. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Addison Russell squares around for one of two Cubs' safety squeezes in the second inning where the Chicago plated 5 runs. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Matt Carpenter leads off the game with a solo home run to give the Cardinals a 1-0 lead. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cardinals catcher Yadier Molina waves to the crowd before game starts. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: The Budweiser Clydesdales parade around the warning track before Game 2 of the NLDS. Jeff Curry, \USA TODAY Sports Game 2 in St. Louis: Cardinals second baseman Kolten Wong commits a throwing error in the second inning. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals relief pitcher Trevor Rosenthal celebrates with catcher Yadier Molina after defeating the Chicago Cubs. Scott Rovak, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Chicago Cubs manager Joe Maddon shows some frustration. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals left fielder Stephen Piscotty touches home plate after hitting a two-run home run in the 8th inning. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals pinch hitter Thomas Pham hits a solo home run in the 8th inning. Scott Rovak, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals starting pitcher John Lackey waves to fans after being pulled in the 8th inning. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals shortstop Jhonny Peralta (27) makes a play. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals starting pitcher John Lackey reacts after inducing a double play to end the top of the 7th inning. Scott Rovak, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cubs outfielder Kyle Schwarber (12) lays down a bunt in the seventh inning. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: The crowd waves white towels during the sixth inning. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: The Cardinals meet at the mound. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Chicago Cubs starting pitcher Jon Lester (34) and catcher David Ross (3) meet at the mound during the fourth inning. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Chicago Cubs outfielder Kyle Schwarber (12) catches a fly ball in the third inning. Scott Rovak, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals second baseman Kolten Wong (left) turns a double play over Cubs outfielder Kyle Schwarber (12) in the fourth inning. cott Rovak, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cubs infielder Starlin Castro throws out Cardinals left fielder Matt Holliday (not pictured) in the third inning. Scott Rovak, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals left fielder Stephen Piscotty (55) scores while Cubs catcher David Ross (3) attempts to tag during the second inning. Jeff Curry, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals starting pitcher John Lackey (41) delivers a pitch against the Cubs. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cardinals left fielder Stephen Piscotty (55) reacts after scoring a run against the Cubs in the first inning. Scott Rovak, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cubs starting pitcher Jon Lester throws a pitch against the Cardinals in the first inning. Scott Rovak, USA TODAY Sports Game 1 in St. Louis: Cubs outfielder Kyle Schwarber (12) and manager Joe Maddon (70) high five before the game.
